files.patch:
@@ -1806,9 +1806,5 @@ - * If this region's snapToPixel property is true, then the value is either floored (positive values) or - * ceiled (negative values) with a scale. When the absolute value of the given value - * multiplied by the current scale is less than 10^15, then this method guarantees that: - * - * 
snapInnerSpaceX(snapInnerSpaceX(value)) == snapInnerSpaceX(value)
- * - * The limit is about 10^15 because double values will no longer be able to represent - * larger integers with exact precision beyond this limit. - * + * If this region's snapToPixel property is true, returns the value of the nearest + * pixel in the horizontal direction with the same or smaller value, else returns the + * same value. + * @param value the size value to be snapped + * @return value adjusted to nearest pixel @@ -1816,2 +1812,0 @@ - * @param value The value that needs to be snapped - * @return value either as passed, or floored or ceiled with scale, based on snapToPixel property @@ -1824,9 +1818,5 @@ - * If this region's snapToPixel property is true, then the value is either floored (positive values) or - * ceiled (negative values) with a scale. When the absolute value of the given value - * multiplied by the current scale is less than 10^15, then this method guarantees that: - * - * 
snapInnerSpaceY(snapInnerSpaceY(value)) == snapInnerSpaceY(value)
- * - * The limit is about 10^15 because double values will no longer be able to represent - * larger integers with exact precision beyond this limit. - * + * If this region's snapToPixel property is true, returns the value of the nearest + * pixel in the vertical direction with the same or smaller value, else returns the + * same value. + * @param value the size value to be snapped + * @return value adjusted to nearest pixel @@ -1834,2 +1824,0 @@ - * @param value The value that needs to be snapped - * @return value either as passed, or floored or ceiled with scale, based on snapToPixel property
